1.1 Purpose and scope  
This policy is provided to set out in clear and transparent terms Liverpool City 
Council’s (LCC) approach to charging for all non -residential social care provision.  
This includes mental health (excluding S.117), physical disability, learning disability 
and older people services. The document aims to provide information in an 
accessible format for people, advisors and staff administering the charges. It is 
hoped that the information will support people in understanding the scheme and help 
them make informed  choices about paying for care.

2.1 Objectives  
LCC’s policy and guidance on charging for non -residential social care is designed to 
be:   
• Constructive to promote well -being, social inclusion and support 
personalisation, independence and choice  
• Compliant with relevant legislation and statutory guidance  
• Provide fair and reasonable charging which seeks to ensures no -one is 
charged more than they can afford  
• Comprehensive (including references to supporting national guidance)

[Page 19 - FINANCIAL/BUDGET INFORMATION]
Liverpool City Council – Guide to direct payments  
Page 18 of 21 11 Contributing towards your care costs  
Your direct payment will be made minus any financial contribution that you may be 
asked to make. Your contribution will be decided as a result of a financial 
assessment. This will calculate how much you can afford to contribute toward the 
cost of your care. More information on contributions is available on the council 
website at liverpool.gov.uk/payingforcare.  
In most cases you will be asked to deposit your contribution into your direct 
payments account. You will receive a statement from us telling you how much you 
have to pay every four weeks.

The available documents don't provide specific information about how much of Liverpool's planned savings are targeted to come from social care services. 

For more detailed financial information or updates, you may want to contact Liverpool City Council directly or visit their official website at [liverpool.gov.uk](https://www.liverpool.gov.uk).
